newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Bank of Korea steps in again to support won.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Korea steps in again to support won.

text.p: The central bank of Korea intervened for the second time in the interbank market in late Friday morning to support the won, dealers said.
They said the central bank sold dollars at around the 844.50 level.

The central bank stepped into the market shortly after the won/dollar trading began at the 845 level. This compared with a base mid-rate of 842.70 set for the day based on Thursday's trading. The won closed the session at a high of 842.30.
"The Bank of Korea seems to have set 845 as the ceiling today," said a foreign bank dealer.

Traders said trading would be cautious in the afternoon in the face of the central bank's determination to support the won. But pressure from import settlements and the market's heavy dollar shortage would continue to press on the domestic unit.
